Award.AwardTitle: REU Site: Number Theory at the University of Wisconsin
Award.AbstractNarration:
The PI will organize intense eight week summer research experiences in number theory for 8 undergraduates (at least half women) in the summer of 2009, 2010, and 2011 in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Wisconsin at Madison. The students will be selected by a nationwide search.

After one week of introductory lectures, the students will be divided into teams. The presiding REU staff will consist of two team leaders (the PI and one postdoc), and two Research Assistants (i.e. advanced PhD students). The REU program aims to attract talented undergraduate students to careers in the mathematical sciences. It will also be a fundamental catalyst towards further establishing a permanent tradition of mentoring young mathematicians in teaching and research at Wisconsin. This program will attract new generations of students to science and mathematics.
